danish_publication: Tvilum kirkes bygning faldt to gange. Så bestemte de at spænde to stude sammen med et reb og lade dem gå. Hvor de fandt dem liggende om morgenen, skulde kirken stå. Så lagde de dem sådan i et morads, og så var der en gammel mand, der sagde: "Ja, a tvivlte nok om det." Deraf fik kirken sit navn.
english_publication: The Tvilum church building collapsed twice. Then they decided to hitch two steers together with a rope and let them go. The church was to stand where they found them lying the next morning. They lay down in a morass, and then there was an old man who said, "Well, I doubted (tvilte) that." And that's where the church got its name.

etk_index.heading_danish: Kirker og deres opbyggelse. Klostre, hellige kilder, m. m.
etk_index.heading_english: Churches and their construction. Monasteries, holy springs, etc.
